gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo </semantics> </math> 2 <math alttext="N 2 gas plus O 2 gas is in equilibrium with 2 N O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="4.2 times 10 to the negative 31 power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>31</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> The table above shows data for two reactions carried out in two separate evacuated 1.0-liter rigid containers at constant temperature of <math alttext="298 Kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. To each container <math alttext="0.50 mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the appropriate reactants was added, and the reaction was allowed to reach equilibrium. Based on this information, which of the following correctly compares the relative concentrations of <math alttext="B r C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>BrCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> present inside their respective containers at equilibrium?

choices.label: <math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of B r C l, is equal to the equilibrium molar concentration of N O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[BrCl]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> because equimolecular mixtures of the reactants were allowed to reach equilibrium at the same constant temperature.

<math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of B r C l, is greater than the equilibrium molar concentration of N O" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[BrCl]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> because <math alttext="B r 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are larger molecules that can collide more frequently to form products.

<math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of B r C l, is greater than the equilibrium molar concentration of N O" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[BrCl]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> because the much larger <math alttext="K sub e q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for reaction 1 means that a much higher concentration of products will be present at equilibrium for reaction 1 compared with reaction 2.

<math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of B r C l, is less than the equilibrium molar concentration of N O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[BrCl]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> because the much larger <math alttext="K sub e q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for reaction 1 means that hardly any products will be present at equilibrium compared with reaction 2.

content.answer: <math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of B r C l, is greater than the equilibrium molar concentration of N O" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[BrCl]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> because the much larger <math alttext="K sub e q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for reaction 1 means that a much higher concentration of products will be present at equilibrium for reaction 1 compared with reaction 2.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
